verses.verse: And when any<WH5315> will offer<WH7126> a food<WH4503> offering<WH7133> unto the Lord<WH3068>, his offering<WH7133> shall be of fine flour<WH5560>; and he shall pour<WH3332> oil<WH8081> upon it<WH5414>, and put frankincense on it<WH3828>

And he shall bring<WH935> it to Aaron<WH175>'s sons<WH1121> the priests<WH3548>: and he shall take<WH7061> out<WH8033> his handful<WH7062> of the flour<WH5560> there<WH8081>, and of the oil there<WH3828>, with all the frankincense there and the priest<WH3548> shall burn<WH6999> the memorial<WH234> of it upon the altar<WH4196>, to be an offering made by fire<WH801>, of a sweet<WH5207> smell<WH7381> unto the Lord<WH3068>:

And the remnant<WH3498> of the food offering<WH4503> shall be Aaron<WH175>'s and his sons<WH1121>': it is a thing most<WH6944> holy<WH6944> of the offerings<WH801> of the Lord<WH3068> made by fire<WH801>.

And if you bring<WH7126> an oblation<WH7133> of a food offering<WH4503> baked<WH3989> in the oven<WH8574>, it shall be unleavened<WH4682> cakes<WH2471> of fine flour<WH5560> mingled<WH1101> with oil<WH8081>, or unleavened<WH4682> wafers<WH7550> anointed<WH4886> with oil<WH8081>.
And if your oblation<WH7133> be a food offering<WH4503> baked in a pan<WH4227>, it shall be of fine flour<WH5560> unleavened<WH4682>, mingled<WH1101> with oil<WH8081>.
You shall part<WH6626> it in pieces<WH6595>, and pour<WH3332> oil<WH8081> on it it is a food offering<WH4503>.
And if your oblation<WH7133> be a food offering<WH4503> baked in the fryingpan<WH4802>, it shall be made<WH6213> of fine flour<WH5560> with oil<WH8081>.

And you shall bring<WH935> the food offering<WH4503> that is made<WH6213> of these things unto the Lord<WH3068>: and when it is presented<WH7126> unto the priest<WH3548>, he shall bring<WH5066> it unto the altar<WH4196>.

And the priest<WH3548> shall take<WH7311> from the food offering<WH4503> a memorial<WH234> there<WH6999>, and shall burn it upon the altar<WH4196>: it is an offering made by fire<WH801>, of a sweet<WH5207> smell<WH7381> unto the Lord<WH3068>.

And that which is left<WH3498> of the food offering<WH4503> shall be Aaron<WH175>'s and his sons<WH1121>': it is a thing most<WH6944> holy<WH6944> of the offerings<WH801> of the Lord<WH3068> made by fire<WH801>.

No food offering<WH4503>, which you shall bring<WH7126> unto the Lord<WH3068>, shall be made<WH6213> with yeast<WH2557>: for you shall burn<WH6999> no yeast<WH7603>, nor any honey<WH1706>, in any offering<WH801> of the Lord<WH3068> made by fire<WH801>.
As for the oblation<WH7133> of the firstfruits<WH7225>, you shall offer<WH7126> them unto the Lord<WH3068>: but they shall not be burnt<WH5927> on the altar<WH4196> for a sweet<WH5207> smell<WH7381>.

And every oblation<WH7133> of your food offering<WH4503> shall you season<WH4414> with salt<WH4417>; neither shall you allow the salt<WH4417> of the covenant<WH1285> of your God<WH430> to be lacking<WH7673> from your food offering<WH4503>: with all your offerings<WH7133> you shall offer<WH7126> salt<WH4417>.

And if you offer<WH7126> a food offering<WH4503> of your firstfruits<WH1061> unto the Lord<WH3068>, you shall offer<WH7126> for the food offering<WH4503> of your firstfruits<WH1061> green ears<WH24> of corn dried<WH7033> by the fire<WH784>, even corn beaten<WH1643> out of full ears<WH3759>.
And you shall put<WH5414> oil<WH8081> upon it<WH7760>, and lay frankincense<WH3828> on it it is a food offering<WH4503>.

And the priest<WH3548> shall burn<WH6999> the memorial<WH234> of it<WH1643>, part of the beaten corn there<WH8081>, and part of the oil there<WH3828>, with all the frankincense there it is an offering made by fire<WH801> unto the Lord<WH3068>.
